result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kris B. Ziemke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
1:06 pm - 15CM21 & 15CM31 - Defendant Kris B. Ziemke appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. DA certifies victims rights compliance. Court questions DE regarding right to attorney. DE waives right to attorney. Court finds waiver is free and accepts. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct. 1 in 15CM21. Court questions DE regarding the plea and explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct. 1 in 15CM21 and on motion of DA dismisses and reads in Ct. 2 of 15CM21 and 15CM31. Comments by defendant. Exam by Court. Appeal rights given. Adj. 1:19 pm. 
Court imposes:
15CM21 (Ct. 1): Sentence withheld - 2 years probation. Conditions: $300 fine; $200 DNAAS; $100 DOMAB; $90 SBDA; Attend and successfully complete next available batterer's group; Apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by agent; 30 day jail term, with huber privileges, to commence no later than 06-15-15 @ 4:30 pm.
Plea and sentencing on 05-28-15 at 1:00 pm

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE may not have contact with Lindsey Ziemke, unless there is written consent on file.

15CM21 & 15CM31 - Defendant Kris B. Ziemke appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaints acknowledged, reading waived.    DE plans to retain an attorney.  Court gives DE another notice of right to atty.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  One bond for both cases.
